ygData.msgSnippet: My motivation for implementing k-means clustering and some issues encountered along the way are documented here:

Subject: Overview of speciation by k-means clustering
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770313; y=L6wVtluRIziPT7An9z61aXv7E8v3z5h1ASUobzA6V_tNxQ0wxCSq

My motivation for implementing k-means clustering and some issues
encountered along the way are documented here:

http://sites.google.com/site/sharpneat/speciation

It turns out that original NEAT's inter-genome distance calculation is
very similar to Manhattan distance and so I implemented it by
generalising Manhattan distance to incorporate something akin to the
NEAT compatibility coefficients. However, I still don't have the
correct equation for calculating a centroid when using Manhattan
distance. My initial attempt at the maths suggests there is a single
analytical expression and I strongly suspect that the arithmetic
average is a good approximation for now anyway.

Colin
